newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand forms group with South Asian states.
newsitem.headline: Thailand forms group with South Asian states.

text.p: Ministers from Bangladesh, India, Sri Lanka and Thailand on Friday signed a declaration launching BIST-EC, a new regional economic and social grouping.

The launch of Bangladesh, India, Sri Lanka, Thailand -- Economic Cooperation won approval of analysts as a move toward building economic infrastructure to link with those of the Association of South East Asian Nations (ASEAN).
"BIST-EC will help Thailand expand trade and investment with countries near ASEAN," Somchai Phagaphasvivat, lecturer at Thammasat University, told Reuters.
"In AFTA (ASEAN Free Trade Area), there is no mention of road linkage and BIST-EC could help fill this infrastructure gap between its members and other regional countries," he said.
ASEAN, grouping Brunei, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Vietnam and Thailand, is due to be joined this year by Burma, Cambodia and Laos.
BIST-EC was initiated by Thailand. "Thailand started the
idea and Thailand has the vision. India is going to play the very important role in making this declaration a reality," Indian Minister of State Saleem Iqbal Shervani said at the launch.

The four member countries said they would hold annual ministerial meetings and their senior officials would hold regular talks on cooperation in trade, investment, industry, tourism, agriculture, energy and other development fields.
